name: Edenator
description:
Edenator is a browser-based music visualizer heavily inspired by Tetsuya Mizuguchi's Rez. Select an audio track from your device and listen/view. All audio processing is performed client-side and your file is not transmitted remotely.

The visuals used by this application may not be suitable for people with photosensitive epilepsy.

Your browser must support WebGL 2.0 and the Web Audio API, which includes recent versions of Firefox, Safari, and Chrome/Chromium browsers.

Mobile browsers are also supported, but require that you have audio files that can be selected. For iOS devices, this means that the audio files must be present within a folder such as "Downloads", instead of in the iTunes library.

Gamepad support is more browser-dependent. for example, while both Firefox and Chrome support detecting connected gamepads, only Chrome will support haptic feedback.
